snippet: A new analysis found out-of-pocket spending on the pill dropped by about half in the first six months of 2013 compared with a year earlier.
abstract: Study published online in Health Affairs finds that passage of Affordable Care Act has resulted in women spending far less out-of-pocket for most birth control methods; estimates cost savings from birth control pill alone, most popular form of birth control, was around $1.4 billion in 2013.
lead_paragraph: A new analysis found out-of-pocket spending on the pill dropped by about half in the first six months of 2013 compared with a year earlier.

headline.main: After Health Care Act, Sharp Drop in Spending on Birth Control
headline.print_headline: Women Are Paying Less for Birth Control, Study Finds

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
